title: If Biden is doing as well in the polls as Clinton did in 2016, why doesn't it mean that Trump will win?
selftext:
Just to make sure I wasn't imagining it, I went back to find articles from 2016:
* October 9: [Polls: Clinton leads Trump by double-digits in PA, neck-and-neck in Florida](https://www.cnn.com/2016/10/09/politics/hillary-clinton-donald-trump-florida-pennsylvania-polls)
* November 2: [Poll: Clinton leads in Wisconsin, but Senate race tight](https://www.politico.com/blogs/swing-states-2016-election/2016/11/poll-clinton-winning-wisconsin-230638)

If Biden is doing as well as Clinton did in 2016, shouldn't we compensate for how far off the polls were in 2016 to get the "true" polling rate? For example, if Clinton was leading by 1% but actually lost by 1%, shouldn't we subtract 2% from Biden's margin as well?
